items.text: that I may make the voice of thanksgiving to be heardand tell of all your wondrous deeds.
giving thanks to the Father, who made us fit to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light,

But he gives more grace. Therefore it says, God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble.
The fear of Yahweh teaches wisdom.Before honor is humility.
For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.
subjecting yourselves to one another in the fear of Christ.
Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time,
Before destruction the heart of man is proud,but before honor is humility.
If you are willing and obedient,you will eat the good of the land
Whoever therefore humbles himself as this little child is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven.
Have this in your mind, which was also in Christ Jesus,
Put on therefore, as Gods chosen ones, holy and beloved, a heart of compassion, kindness, lowliness, humility, and perseverance
Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he will exalt you.
A mans pride brings him low,but one of lowly spirit gains honor.
But not so with you. Rather, the one who is greater among you, let him become as the younger, and one who is governing, as one who serves.
Yahweh upholds the humble.He brings the wicked down to the ground.
The humble also will increase their joy in Yahweh, and the poor among men will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
Whoever desires to be first among you shall be your bondservant,
Therefore, putting away all filthiness and overflowing of wickedness, receive with humility the implanted word, which is able to save your souls.
But the humble shall inherit the land,and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
Let another man praise you,and not your own moutha stranger, and not your own lips.
Blessed are the gentle,for they shall inherit the earth.
Dont exalt yourself in the presence of the king,or claim a place among great men
Whoever of you wants to become first among you shall be bondservant of all.
